page.title: 13HOUSING DEVELOPMENT
page.content: approximately 650 second and holiday homes were situated in Frinton and Walton.The number of vacant dwellings being 126 for the same area. The Frinton and Walton district is served by 2 stations, located on a branch line connecting them with Colchester.This has thus led to commuter developments; the greater number of commuters being served by Walton station in this study area. Walton railway station was constructed in 1867. The study area is served by 2 classified 'B' roads: B1336, Frinton to Walton (junction with Kirby road); B1034, runs between Kirby and Thorpe (ending at Walton). Many estate developments have been built to infill between and be served by these two 'B' roads. Within Frinton and Walton there are
